jmortgage.amortization
Class DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder

java.lang.Object
  jmortgage.amortization.DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
FixedAmortizationBuilder
public final class DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder
extends Object
implements FixedAmortizationBuilder

The default implementation of FixedAmortizationBuilder. This object builds an amortization schedule based on the values of the PmtCalculator and PmtKey implementations it receives. When building the amortization schedule, it can receive extra payments that are calculated into the amortization schedule. This object is immutable as long as the PmtCalculator and PmtKey implementations it receives are immutable. DefaultPmtCalculator and DefaultPmtKey are immutable, so if these implementations are used, this object is immutable, so its thread safety is guaranteed. Note: While thread safety of the object itself would be guaranteed, two of the buildAmortizationTable methods take Collection arguments that represent extra payments and these objects may need to be synchronized to guarantee their thread safety.

Version:
1.0
Author:
David Armstrong

buildAmortizationTable

public SortedMap<Long,FixedAmortizationBuilder.Payment> buildAmortizationTable()
Builds the amortization table. The table is represented as a SortedMap that is sorted in chronological order. The key of the map is a Long value representing the date that the payment is due. The value is a DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder.DefaultPayment object. DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder uses Google Collection Library's ImmutableSortedMap to encapsulate the amortization table. Use of this implementation is immutable, guaranteeing the return value's thread safety.

Specified by:
buildAmortizationTable in interface FixedAmortizationBuilder
Returns:
amortization table as an ImmutableSortedMap object.

buildAmortizationTable

public SortedMap<Long,FixedAmortizationBuilder.Payment> buildAmortizationTable(Map<Long,Double> extraPmtMap)
Builds the amortization table and processes the specified map of extra payments. A defensive copy of the extra payments is made. Clients who need to ensure thread safety of the map of extra payments should synchronize its modification in another thread or use a thread-safe implementation of a map like ConcurrentHashMap or Google's ImmutableMap in case of the slight chance that a modification of the map occurs at the same time the defensive copy is made. The table is represented as a SortedMap that is sorted in chronological order. The key of the map is a Long value representing the date that the payment is due. The value is a DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder.DefaultPayment object. DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder uses Google Collection Library's ImmutableSortedMap to encapsulate the amortization table. Use of this implementation is immutable, guaranteeing the return value's thread safety.

Specified by:
buildAmortizationTable in interface FixedAmortizationBuilder
Parameters:
extraPmtMap - A map of extra payments. The key is a Long that represents the date that the extra payment will be paid. This date must match exactly with one of the regular payments in the amortization schedule.
Returns:
amortization table as an ImmutableSortedMap object

buildAmortizationTable

public SortedMap<Long,FixedAmortizationBuilder.Payment> buildAmortizationTable(List<ExtraPmt> extraPmtList)
Builds the amortization table and processes the specified list of extra payments which are represented as implementations of ExtraPmt. A defensive copy of the extra payments is made. Clients who need to ensure thread safety of the list of extra payments should synchronize its modification in another thread or use a thread-safe implementation of a list like CopyOnWriteArrayList or Google's ImmutableList in case of the slight chance that a modification of the list occurs at the same time the defensive copy is made. This method is a convenience method to save the client the trouble of creating an implementation of ExtraPmtMapBuilder. If a client is planning to use the same extra payments for more than one amortization schedule, it should create a map of extra payments itself with an implementation of ExtraPmtMapBuilder. The table is represented as a SortedMap that is sorted in chronological order. The key of the map is a Long value representing the date that the payment is due. The value is a DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder.DefaultPayment object. DefaultFixedAmortizationBuilder uses Google Collection Library's ImmutableSortedMap to encapsulate the amortization table. Use of this implementation is immutable, guaranteeing the return value's thread safety.

Specified by:
buildAmortizationTable in interface FixedAmortizationBuilder
Parameters:
extraPmtList - A List of extra payments represented as ExtraPmt implementations
Returns:
amortization table as an ImmutableSortedMap object
